channel.title: Bash on James K. Pringle
channel.description: Recent content in Bash on James K. Pringle

item.title: Start using Bash
item.description: One of the reasons I switched to Mac when Windows 8 came out was Mac’s UNIX-y background. I liked being able to open a terminal and do all the things I had been learning about in my computer science classes. Mac’s default shell is Bash, or the Bourne Again SHell. Sure, I could cd around, ls directories, and cp or mv things. But, I knew I was not even close to tapping the power of the shell.
